data.question: What is the primary strategy used in the synthesis of FJU-6 to increase the diversity of metal–organic frameworks (MOFs)?
data.answer: The primary strategy used in the synthesis of FJU-6 involves integrating the pillared-layer strategy and pore-space partition (PL-PSP) method.

data.question: What are the key components introduced in the synthesis of FJU-6?
data.answer: The key components introduced in the synthesis of FJU-6 are three distinct functional ligands (H3BTB, HINA, and H2BDC) and one metal salt (CoCl2·6H2O).

data.question: How does the BET surface area range and CO2 adsorption capacity vary among the FJU-6-X series?
data.answer: The BET surface area range among the FJU-6-X series varies from 731 to 1306 m2/g, and the CO2 adsorption capacity increases by 77%.

data.question: What is the significance of the {Co6}-cluster-based pillars in FJU-6's structure?
data.answer: The {Co6}-cluster-based pillars in FJU-6's structure contribute to its new (3,9,12)-connected llz topology.

data.question: What role do the substituted analogues of ligands and metal ions play in the synthesis of isoreticular mm-MOFs?
data.answer: The substituted analogues of ligands and metal ions play a role in synthesizing isoreticular mm-MOFs with adjustable BET surface areas and enhanced adsorption capacities.

data.question: Is the statement 'FJU-6-TATB exhibits effective separation toward the C2H2/CO2 mixture under ambient conditions' true or false?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the PL-PSP method contribute to the robustness and permanent porosity of mm-MOFs?
data.answer: True

data.question: Can the PL-PSP method be extended beyond the construction of mm-MOFs?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is FJU-6 the first example of a quinary member of MOF with two distinct cobalt metal clusters?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the thermal stability of FJU-6-Ni surpass that of FJU-6 due to the more stable Ni–Ni bond?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the impact of Lewis base sites on ligands on the C2H2 adsorption capacity in mm-MOFs?
data.answer: The impact of Lewis base sites on ligands in mm-MOFs is an increase in the C2H2 adsorption capacity.

data.question: How does the pore environment modification in FJU-6-TATB influence its gas adsorption and separation performance?
data.answer: The pore environment modification in FJU-6-TATB influences its gas adsorption and separation performance by optimizing the structure for highly efficient C2H2/CO2 separation.

data.question: What is the role of the {Co3}-cluster-based sheets in the structure of FJU-6?
data.answer: The {Co3}-cluster-based sheets in the structure of FJU-6 contribute to its unique topology and functionality.

data.question: Is the statement 'All FJU-6-X series MOFs crystallize in the same space group' true or false?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the PL-PSP approach in constructing multicomponent MOFs?
data.answer: The significance of the PL-PSP approach in constructing multicomponent MOFs lies in its ability to produce MOFs with fascinating structures and enhanced gas adsorption and separation properties.

data.question: Does the introduction of different metal ions or functional groups of the ligand affect the Co3 and Co6 cluster nodes in the mm-MOFs?
data.answer: False

data.question: Can the mm-MOFs tolerate the substitution of ligands and metals without changing the topology?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of modifying ligands 1 and 3 with large groups on the mm-MOFs frameworks?
data.answer: Modifying ligands 1 and 3 with large groups in the mm-MOFs frameworks significantly reduces the accessible diameter of the channel.

data.question: Is FJU-6-TATB capable of achieving highly efficient separation of C2H2/CO2 mixtures in laboratory-scale fixed-bed dynamic breakthrough experiments?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of the distorted trigonal bipyramidal cages in the structure of FJU-6?
data.answer: The distorted trigonal bipyramidal cages in the structure of FJU-6 serve as nodes and contribute to the unique topology and functionality of the MOF.
